item.title: Booting Up Windows Server 2019
item.author: Nguyen Nguyen
item.description: Last time, We installed an virtual machine for our Windows Server. In this post, we are going to boot up our virtual machine and complete the installation.

item.title: Create a Empty Shell Windows Server using HyperV
item.author: Nguyen Nguyen
item.description: Before we can install a Windows Server, We need to create an Virtual Machine using HyperV

item.title: OS Detection/Traceroute
item.author: Nguyen Nguyen
item.description: Note: If you need a better view of the image, you can right click on the image -> Open image in a new tab. OS Detection To initiate a OS Detection with Nmap, you can use the -O For example: sudo nmap -O 192.168.233.139 Traceroute If you want Nmap to find the routers between you and the target, you would add –traceroute For example: sudo nmap -sS --traceroute 192.168.233.139

item.title: Open-Closed Ports
item.author: Nguyen Nguyen
item.description: In this post, I will establish rules to how to figure out which port are closed/open. No matter what type of scan you use. Additionally, we will cover scans to use against firewalls.

item.title: Service Detection using Nmap
item.author: Nguyen Nguyen
item.description: Using Nmap, We will feature: service detection to investigate for any vulnerability in a service. Then, we will look at it from a wireshark perspective to see what it look like from a network point of view.

item.title: Reconnaissance (CKC) - Modern Cyber Range - Attacker PoV
